title.narrative: NATIONAL AND DISTRICT M&E SYSTEMS IMPROV

description.narrative: National and District level institutions have the tools, strategies and resources for data production, dissemination and use for child and woman focused planning, integrated monitoring and evaluation applying RBM and HRBA standards by 2016., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: M&E Systems provide reliable data for monitoring MDGs and other national goals and advocacy for children and women by 2016.

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses

related-activity.ref: 2690/A0/05/043 IMPROVED M&E SYSTEMS FOR NATIONAL PROGS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and District level institutions have the tools, strategies and resources for data production, dissemination and use for child and woman focused planning, integrated monitoring and evaluation applying RBM and HRBA standards by 2016.

description.narrative: Medium term planning and monitoring frameworks well contextualize and address concerns of children and women. Academia, local and international institutions were engaged to introduce innovative approaches and improved capacities for planning, including at the local level and for evidence generation to better position UNICEF as a knowledge-leader on children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2018

title.narrative: New evidence on children and women generated for children
Monitoring systems at national and district level to monitor results for children and women improved

actual.value: 2018:Yes, data was generated and entered in the national system but has not been published

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of Planning and monitoring systems that explicitly address risks at national and subnational level
